it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.attachedProperties

Interface PropertyTarget

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Node
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Control, PropertyContainer

    public interface PropertyTarget
    The interface provides methods for dynamically extending objects by attaching and detaching properties. Properties are instances of the Property and changes in their values can be observed by means of PropertyListener. Use the PropertyContainer to implement this interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Property<?> attachProperty(Property<?> prop)
      Attaches a property to the object.
      <V> Property<V> detachProperty(Property<V> prop)
      Detaches a property from the object.

      Detaches a property from the object by its name.
      java.util.Collection<Property<?>> getProperties()
      The collection of all properties attached to the object.
      <V> Property<V> getProperty(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a property attached to the object by its name, null if there is no property for the given name.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames()
      The names properties attached to the object.

    • Method Detail

      • attachProperty

        Property<?> attachProperty(Property<?> prop)
        Attaches a property to the object. Properties with the same name are replaced.
        Parameters:
        prop - the property to be attached.
        Returns:
        the old property (if any).

      • detachProperty

        <V> Property<V> detachProperty(Property<V> prop)
        Detaches a property from the object. The method return the property if it was actually attached, otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        prop - the property to be detached.
        Returns:
        the detached property.

      • detachProperty

        <V> Property<V> detachProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Detaches a property from the object by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property to be detached.
        Returns:
        the detached property.

      • getProperty

        <V> Property<V> getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a property attached to the object by its name, null if there is no property for the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property to be retieved.
        Returns:
        the property.

      • getProperties

        java.util.Collection<Property<?>> getProperties()
        The collection of all properties attached to the object.
        Returns:
        the property collection.

      • getPropertyNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames()
        The names properties attached to the object.
        Returns:
        the names collection.
